page.title: 08Roadverge Nature Reserves.
page.content: There are over 2,500 acres of road verges in Bedfordshire providing habitats for a wide range of wildlife including birds,mammals,butterflies and reptiles.They are often important for flowers,particularly as Bedfordshire has few flower-rich meadows left.The verges have species which are now uncommon in the surrounding countryside.The most important of these verges have been identified by the County Wildlife Trust and one such area occurs along the sides of the Sharnbrook to Thurleigh road.The County Council is responsible for the management of the road verges.With their co-operation this Nature Reserve has been marked with posts and an 'NR' sign to try to ensure protection from dumping and damage from pipe-laying or road works.
